marketNews.title: Crude Oil Prices Strengthen Following Explosions in Iran and Protests in Libya
marketNews.content:
Brent crude oil prices in the spot market have strengthened by +4.2% since closing on Tuesday (2/1) to a level of 79.35 US dollars per barrel. At least, there are two main factors that have been catalysts for the strengthening of crude oil prices in the last two days:

- Explosions in Iran - On Wednesday (3/1), two explosions occurred near the funeral of an Iranian military commander. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the explosions that killed at least 103 people. On the other hand, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi blamed Israel for the explosion.
- Closure of oil fields in Libya - The strengthening of oil prices was also driven by the closure of Libya's largest oil field, the Sharara Oil Field, on Wednesday (3/1). The oil field, which produces 300 thousand barrels per day, was shut down by local residents protesting high fuel prices in Libya and a lack of economic opportunities.

The escalation of geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran, along with the shutdown of Libya's largest oil field, has triggered concerns about disruptions to the world's crude oil supply.

As of November 2023, Iran was the 8th largest crude oil producer in the world with a production of 3.12 million barrels per day, equivalent to ~3% of global production. Meanwhile, Libya is the 19th largest crude oil producer with a production of 1.2 million barrels per day. A reduction in crude oil production of 300 thousand barrels per day from Libya has the potential to reduce global crude oil supply by ~0.3%.

Responding to rising oil prices, oil-related issuers experienced appreciation in today's trading, Thursday (4/1), with MEDC (+2.61%), ENRG (+2.5%), ELSA (+3.55%), WINS (+3.96%), LEAD (+2.99%).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway on Oil Prices and Global Economy
marketNews.content: Potential supply disruptions from geopolitical tension escalation can provide support for oil prices amidst concerns of weak demand due to expectations of global economic growth weakening this year. However, if China's economy performs better than expected, it could support global growth.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Finance Notes Primary Balance of State Budget 2023 Surplus
marketNews.content:
Finance Minister Sri Mulyani raised excise tax on alcoholic beverages starting January 1, 2024. The rate of the excise tax increase varies depending on the alcohol content and the origin of the product, with Category A +10%, local Category B +28.8%, and local Category C +26.3%.

The Ministry of Finance noted that the primary balance of the State Budget (APBN) for 2023 recorded a surplus of 92.2 trillion rupiah. This is the first time the APBN achieved a primary balance surplus since 2012. The 2023 APBN recorded a deficit of 347.6 trillion rupiah (1.65% of GDP), marking the lowest deficit since 2011 and lower than the initial target of 598.2 trillion rupiah (2.84% of GDP).

tickerNews.title: ASII Resumes Daihatsu Car Exports After Safety Scandal Assurance
tickerNews.content: ASII: Exports of Daihatsu brand cars from Astra International's business entity, PT Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM), resumed as of December 26, 2023, after receiving confirmation from the authorities in the destination countries. Previously, Daihatsu car exports from ADM were halted due to the safety test scandal issue by Daihatsu Motor in Japan. ADM Vice President Director, Erlan Krisnaring Cahyono, explained that the production and distribution of Daihatsu vehicles in Indonesia remain normal, while exports have resumed to more than 60 countries.

tickerNews.title: INCO Divestment Price Reportedly Set Between Rp4,500-Rp5,000 Per Share
tickerNews.content: INCO: Katadata reports that the divestment of 14% of Vale Indonesia's shares to MIND ID will use the 90-day average price in the range of 4,500-5,000 rupiah per share, which is +2.5-13.9% higher than INCO's closing share price of 4,390 rupiah per share as of Thursday (4/1). Katadata's sources state that this price was taken due to the tough negotiation process, where Vale desired a price of 1.5x Price-to-Book Value, around 5,900 per share, while the government sought a price below the market price. This transaction is reported to be completed in early February 2024. INCO and MIND ID have not yet commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: WIIM Sells Approximately 3.8 Million Buyback Shares
tickerNews.content: WIIM: Wismilak Inti Makmur announced that it has sold approximately 3.8 million shares resulting from a buyback at an average price of 3,411.72 rupiah per share during October-December 2023. The total funds obtained by WIIM from this corporate action reached approximately 12.93 billion rupiah. WIIM previously planned to sell 27.9 million shares from the buyback between October 30, 2023, and October 9, 2024, meaning there are still 24.1 million buyback shares that WIIM has not yet sold.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Targets 800 New Stores in 2024, Focusing Outside Major Cities
tickerNews.content: AMRT: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya targets the addition of 800 new stores in 2024. This store expansion is targeted for areas outside major Indonesian cities, especially outside Java Island. AMRT's GM Corporate Communications, Rani Wijaya, stated that the number of AMRT stores as of the end of 2023 reached 19,100 stores (versus 17,813 in 2022).

tickerNews.title: PALM Injects Rp1.86 Trillion Capital into Subsidiary SAM
tickerNews.content: PALM: Provident Investasi Bersama injected capital worth 1.86 trillion rupiah into its subsidiary engaged in investment, PT Suwarna Arta Mandiri (SAM), through a new share subscription. The transaction value is equivalent to 44.61% of PALM's equity as of June 30, 2023. The transaction is aimed at fulfilling SAM's funding needs.

tickerNews.title: Mixue Group Applies for Hong Kong IPO
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the bubble tea producer Mixue Group registered for an IPO on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on Tuesday (2/1) with a funding target of 500 million-1 billion US dollars. Mixue itself has 36,000 outlets. Mixue previously registered for an IPO on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2022 with a funding target of 909.87 million US dollars, but there has been no further news regarding that potential listing.

tickerNews.title: US Job Openings Decline in November 2023
tickerNews.content: The number of job openings in the US decreased by 62,000 to 8.79 million in November 2023, marking the lowest level since March 2021 and falling below the consensus expectation of 8.85 million. This realization also marks the third consecutive month of declining job openings in the US, reflecting a weakening US labor market condition.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Acquires 8% Participation Rights in Jabung Block
tickerNews.content: RAJA: Rukun Raharja, through its subsidiary, PT Raharja Energi Tanjung Jabung, officially acquired an 8% participation right in the Jabung oil and gas block from PT GPI Jabung Indonesia with an undisclosed transaction value.
